technology: There were no technical difficulties during the conversation.
cur_neg_affect: The participant expresses some frustration with the ongoing discussion about COVID and the restrictions, but also acknowledges the seriousness of the illness.
past_neg_affect: The participant expresses frustration with the mandates, lockdowns, and mask-wearing during the pandemic.
communal_orientation: The participant engages in conversation, asks questions, and expresses sympathy for those who experienced heartache during the pandemic, but doesn't build off of the conversation partner's story.
engagement: The participant is generally engaged in the conversation, sharing their experiences and responding to the other person's comments.
defensiveness: The participant becomes somewhat defensive when discussing their skepticism about the vaccine and feeling judged for their choices.
perspective_statements: (09:57-10:03): So I empathize or I sympathize. I don't know what the proper term would be for this. With the people that experienced all that heartache and all that heartbreak and not being able to be with their family members or missing out on important events.
(10:11-10:22): You know, weddings and things like that. So. I do feel bad. I do have compassion for those people and I understand. Everybody's perspective.
vaccine_importance: At the end of the conversation, the participant expresses skepticism about the COVID-19 vaccine and states they will not be getting boosted unless their health condition changes.
booster_importance: The participant states they will not be getting boosted unless their health condition changes.
cognitive_complexity: The participant demonstrates a moderate amount of cognitive complexity by acknowledging different perspectives, weighing pros and cons, and recognizing the uncertainty surrounding the long-term effects of the vaccine.
general_notes: The participant expresses skepticism about the COVID-19 vaccine and mandates, but also shows empathy for those who suffered during the pandemic. They emphasize personal choice and feeling safe with their decisions.
